div.bibl: Svenska Kuriren, Oct. 25, 1917. [S. N. S. MEETS]

body.p: The Swedish National Society in Chicago had its meeting Monday, in the Sherman Hotel. Erik Thulin is president. Many other lodges and delegates were present. It appeared that the committee in charge of auditing the books for last summer's activities had not yet completed its work. At the meeting more money was contributed towards activities of the Swedish people, within the society, as well as without.
The members decided to give a bazaar in March at North Side Turner Hall.
